content.title: Chief Minister Floriculture Mission
content.beneficiary: Farmers, especially small and marginal farmers, women SHGs, and unemployed youths
content.details: Prevalence of suitable agro climate has led to natural occurrence of a large number of flowering species in Assam having aesthetic value and horticultural importance. The floriculture sector in Assam is largely confined to household gardens, with commercial pockets being minimal. The scheme aims to enhance floriculture in the state, which currently registers an area of 1800 ha under total floriculture.
benefits: Govt. will provide planting materials, required quantity of shade net and one garden tool kit as Govt. share.
Beneficiaries will have to erect the bamboo/steel structure themselves under observation of departmental officers as beneficiaryâ€™s share.
Cost of bed preparation, fertilizer etc. will have to be borne by the beneficiaries.
Departmental officers will provide complete technical support to the beneficiaries.
For the year 2015-16, cultivation of Gerbera under Shade net house with tissue cultured planting materials is proposed to be taken up covering an area of 200 sqm. per unit area.
eligibility: The component will be implemented in rural and urban areas.
Beneficiaries should be of small and marginal category.
Women SHGs and unemployed youths should get preference.
Beneficiaries should have their own land in their premises or rented land on long term lease.
Modern cultivation technology will be disseminated by the concerning departmental officers through training and skill teaching.
One beneficiary can avail only one unit of 200 sqm.
Proper representation from SC and ST farmers should be ensured.
Beneficiary selection will be finalized by the District Level Beneficiaries Selection Committee through wide publicity in mass media.
The District Level Beneficiaries Selection Committee will monitor the program time to time.
content.application_process: Offline. Please contact the office of the Secretary to the Govt. of Assam Agriculture Department, Dispur, Guwahati-6 or the Director of Horticulture and FP Assam, Khanapara, Guwahati-22.
documents_required: Cultivation of TC Gerbera in Agro shade net house Unit area: 200 sqm.

faqs.question: What About Floriculture Mission?
faqs.answer: A farm based income generating enterprise having high potential to earn foreign exchange and generate employment for rural and urban youths.

faqs.question: When was horticulture mission launched?
faqs.answer: National Horticulture Mission (NHM) is an Indian horticulture Scheme promoted by Government of India. It was launched under the 10th five-year plan in the year 2005-06.

faqs.question: Who is the Father of floriculture?
faqs.answer: Marigowda is also known as Father of Horticulture in India.

faqs.question: Who is the father of floriculture in India?
faqs.answer: Dr. Chadha is aptly referred to as the 'Father of Modern Horticulture'.

faqs.question: Which state is first in floriculture?
faqs.answer: Karnataka is the leader in floriculture, accounting for 75% of India's total flower production.

faqs.question: What is the full form of CSIR?
faqs.answer: The Council of Scientific & Industrial Research (CSIR), known for its cutting edge R&D knowledge base in diverse S&T areas.
